title: Supreme Court recognises menstrual health as a fundamental right
description:
The Supreme Court has recognised menstrual health as a fundamental right under Article 21. The court directed all schools, government and private to provide separate toilets, clean water, free biodegradable sanitary pads, and safe disposal facilities. Schools must also set up menstrual hygiene corners with emergency supplies. The court said lack of such facilities affects students’ dignity, health, and access to education. It added that financial constraints cannot be used as an excuse for non‑compliance. Private schools may lose recognition if they fail to follow the guidelines.

Script and editing:  Shikha Kumari A 
Voice over: Sharmada Venkatasubramanian

Foul air causing deaths? ‘Yes’, ‘can’t say’: 2 govt arms take differing stands
description: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

title: 'Bit her face, hands and legs': CCTV captures horrific dog attack in Bengaluru
description: A morning walk turned terrifying for Shalini Dubey in HSR Layout when a dog attacked her, causing facial and neck injuries. Her husband filed a complaint against the owner, Amaresh Reddy, for negligence. Police have booked Reddy under relevant sections of the BNS for allowing his pet to roam freely, leading to the unprovoked assault.

title: Right-wing group vows to block rebuilding of Bulleh Shah shrine
description: A right-wing group, Kali Sena, has threatened to oppose the reconstruction of Sufi poet Bulleh Shah's mazaar in Mussoorie, vowing to build a Hanuman temple instead. This follows vandalism of the mazaar and protests by Bajrang Dal activists. Congress leaders have urged police action against the threats.

title: Getting into a live-in while already being in one will attract up to 7 yrs’ jail: U’khand UCC
description: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

title: Denied access to funeral ground, Dalits light pyre on Bihar road
description: Dalit villagers in Bihar's Vaishali were allegedly prevented from using the local cremation ground, forcing them to cremate a 91-year-old woman on a public road. The incident, which occurred in Sondho-Vashudeo village, has sparked tensions and prompted an official inquiry into the alleged discrimination.

title: ‘Agents are at my door’: Journalist Georgia Fort films moments before being arrested over anti-ICE protest coverage
Triple murder: Man kills parents, sister, buries bodies in rented house
description: A shocking triple murder has rocked Kottur, where a man, Akshay Kumar, allegedly killed his parents and sister. The victims were reportedly buried within their rented home. Akshay later filed a missing persons report in Bengaluru, attempting to mislead authorities. He confessed to the crime during police interrogation. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: Trichy bus driver slaps passenger multiple times for asking him to avoid rash driving
description: A private bus driver in Trichy was arrested after assaulting a passenger who requested him to slow down due to rash driving. The incident, captured on video, escalated into a physical altercation at the bus stand. The driver faces charges including voluntarily causing hurt and criminal intimidation.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.
